Putin and Zelensky appear set for peace summit after fast-moving Trump talks
subhead: The US President spoke with Putin on Monday following a 'very good' meeting with European leaders and the Ukrainian president, Trump said. 'We are ready,' Zelensky told reporters at the White House, later saying that plans would be 'formalized in some way in the next week or ten days.'

title: Hamas accepts an Arab ceasefire proposal as the Palestinian death toll exceeds 62,000

byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: In Poland, thousands of young people are spending their 'vacation with the army'
subhead: Launched in 2024, this program drew about 10,000 Poles between the ages of 18 and 35 this summer who, after 27 days of training, have now become reservists in the Polish army.

title: Macron calls for sanctions against Russia if diplomacy fails
subhead: The French president reiterated Trump's belief that an agreement could be reached with Putin: 'But if at the end this process is met by refusal, we are also ready to say that we need to increase sanctions.' Macron pointed to recent secondary sanctions the US administration has imposed on India, which have 'had a lot of effects.'

title: In northeastern France, the third life of a synagogue, transformed into a center of contemporary art
subhead: 'Unusual Places for an Exhibition' (1/6). Le Monde explores six art centers housed in unexpected venues. Today: a former sanctuary that was blown up by the Nazis and rebuilt after the war.

title: 'What I would give to inhabit again a country where the gravest offense the president could be accused of was sartorial misconduct'
subhead: 'Letters from America' (2/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams looks back at the 'ludicrous drama' caused by Barack Obama's tan suit in 2014. The contrast with Donald Trump's gaffes is striking.

title: Kim Jong Un urges expansion of North Korea nuclear capability

title: The lobo-guará, Brazil's maned wolf, a national icon under threat
subhead: Emblematic of the Cerrado, these animals have seen their habitat fragmented by deforestation and the spread of industrial agriculture. In the state of Minas Gerais, a sanctuary now shelters some of them, aiming to raise public awareness.
byline: By Bruno Meyerfeld (Caraça Sanctuary (Brazil), special correspondent)

title: After Anchorage summit, Europeans stand firmly behind Zelensky in the face of Trump
subhead: Several leaders from across Europe are set to travel to Washington on Monday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to meet with the American president. The Ukrainian crisis now pits Kyiv and the main European governments against Moscow and Washington.

title: A winemaker, his daughter and a vintage for their undocumented workers
subhead: In southeastern France, Philippe Grisard and his daughter, Nadège, rely daily on undocumented workers to help tend their vineyard. To draw attention to their workers' precarious legal status, they named one of their vintages 'Sans eux' ('Without Them').
